data.title: OT: Tamara Clatterbuck update
data.text:
In a lavish ceremony fit for a soap princess, Days of Our Lives beauty Tamara

Clatterbuck married her wealthy fiance Alexander Farkas.

The pair tied the knot at the beautiful oceanfront Stony Creek, Conn., estate

of his mother, Francine Farkas-Sears, whose fortune comes from the Alexander's

department store chain.

"Alexander comes from such a rich family that it was a truly high-society

affair," an insider reveals. "His mom and Tamara spared no expense and the

wedding cost them six figures."

The actress, who plays Barb on the NBC soap, looked stunning in an elegant

$7,500 white silk organza, v-necked sheath gown from Yumi Katsura Bridal in New

York.

Her groom, who works in the computer industry, was dapper in a black suit,

white shirt and silver tie.

The couple said their vows Sept. 8 before a justice of the peace. In keeping

with Alexander's heritage, the ceremony ended with him crushing a glass under

his foot, a symbolic gesture performed at Jewish weddings, a guest confides to

Star.

After the ceremony, 150 guests, including Tamara's pal Sharon Case from Y&R,

dined under tents on the beach. They enjoyed Cristal champagne, sushi, a New

England clambake, fresh fruit, grilled vegetables and a chocolate wedding cake.

Tamara, 38, and Alexander, who met at a Santa Monica, Calif., nightclub two

years ago, shared a first dance to Joe Cocker's song You Are So Beautiful.

Then the rest of the guests boogied the night away to pop tunes from a disc

jockey.

"The couple spent their honeymoon in the British Virgin Islands," the guest

reveals. "It's the happiest time of Tamara's life."

source: Star 10/9/01
